wikitext.*:
'''''Urulókë''''' (plural ''Urulóki'') is the [[Quenya]] name of the [[fire-drakes]], meaning "fire-serpent"<ref>{{HM|WJ}}, pp. 46, 85, 121, 141</ref><ref name=App/><ref>{{S|Index}}, entry ''Urulóki'': "''Quenya word meaning 'fire-serpent', dragon''"</ref> or "fire-dragon".<ref name=ety>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 370 (entry '''LOK-''')</ref>

==Etymology==
*[[Quenya]] ''ur-'' ("heat, be hot") + ''[[lókë]]''<ref name=App>{{S|Appendix}}, entry ''ur-''</ref><ref name=ety/>

In ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', the form ''Urulóki'' is used both as a singular and plural noun.<ref>{{S|Return}}, [as plural noun]: "''...Glaurung, the first of the Urulóki...''"</ref><ref>{{S|Turin}}, [as singular noun]: "''...Glaurung the Urulóki...''"</ref> 

It has been suggested that the spelling according to the Quenya style of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' would be ''Urulócë'', pl. ''Urulóci''.<ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]], ''[http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/Quettaparma.pdf Quettaparma Quenyallo]'', entry "urulócë" (accessed 13 February 2020)</ref>
==See also==
